title: Is RD Sharma maths sufficient for the class 10 board exam? What if I don't resolve the NCERT at all? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)
Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: Please concentrate on NCERT first. Solve each and every question from it thoroughly. Practice NCERT before tests and exams once again for better clarity. As all teachers say NCERT is bible for 10std. If you are fully confident with NCERT and left with extra time then solve from RD Sharma and RS Agarwal. NCERT exemplar is also very helpful. CBSE or your state board will consider NCERT first for preparing question papers. Reference books are called ‘reference’ books for a reason. Don't divert your concentration from NCERT. If you completely ignore NCERT then certain unpleasant circumstances will come by your way. Solve previous year questions (atleast 100- includes objectives, 2markers,3 markers, 4markers) from all chapters for aiming centum. Best of Luck P.S: Above mentioned are tried and tested. They really work. Surely 95% and above guaranty. Practice practice practice
